answers.answer: Lower extremity open wounds can be extremetly difficult to heal because of poor blood supply. In addition, if you have an underlying medical condition like diabetes, this will also be a problem.  If you have not already done so, you may want to consult with a wound care clinic that specializes in treating problem wounds like yours.

question: I HAD AN OPERATION EIGHT WEEKS AGO TO REPAIR A RUPTURED TENDON IN MY RIGHT ANKLE..ALTHOUGH I HAVE TAKEN SULFAME THOXAZOLE-TMP-DS (FOR BACTRIM DS) AND MADE USE OF A VACUUM MACHINE, MY INCISION HAS FAILED TO HEAL.  I HAVE AN OPEN WOUND THREE INCHES BY ONE AND A HALF INCHES..IT WAS PAIINFUL BEFORE THE OPERATION AND AFTER EIGHT WEEKS IS CRONICALLY PAINFUL WITH NO SIGNS OF HEALING..
title: AN INCISION THAT WON'T HEAL
